intro: Veronicastrum stenostachyum subsp. nanchuanense, commonly known as the Nanchuan false dragonhead, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems, while its flowers bloom in late summer. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
